author.bio:
I'm cqtz- on reddit and cqtz on SaidIt. https://youtube.com/watch?v=o_LskiXQ73c

You can still see my posts on archive.org. And check out +uslashremoved!
author.bio_html:
I'm cqtz- on reddit and cqtz on SaidIt. https://youtube.com/watch?v=o_LskiXQ73c

You can still see my posts on archive.org. And check out +uslashremoved!

body:
Full ban message:

>This account was made to defame the person after whom it is named, defamation is not 1A protected speech.

Here is one of his posts:

"[I am Jordan Peterson. Ask me anything.](https://ruqqus.com/post/1ly6/i-am-jordan-peterson-ask-me)"

+againstwomen is one of his guilds which he has been [advertising](https://ruqqus.com/post/20do/all-lives-matter/6nh5) all [over](https://ruqqus.com/post/20kj/antifa-gets-banned-from-tshirt-company/6nh8) ruqqus. [Here's one of his more recent posts](https://ruqqus.com/post/2jcc/you-are-all-shit-if-you) in +Cooking, which he made shortly before he was banned.

**UPDATE 2020-09-04**: See this: https://ruqqus.com/post/2yn2/free-speech-and-defamation

![](https://i.ibb.co/SPytxLx/sfrohne.png)

post.title: @jordanbpeterson banned for defamation

body:
Defamation =/= Impersonation and it's very clear it's not actually JP from the comments. This is a wrongful ban in my opinion. Libel (written defamation) is only illegal when false statements are made and it can be proven that those statements caused harm to the defamed. I highly doubt that would be the case here.

> In the United States, a person must prove that the statement was false, caused harm, and was made without adequate research into the truthfulness of the statement. These steps are for an ordinary citizen. For a celebrity or public official, a person must prove the first three steps, and that the statement was made with the intent to do harm or with reckless disregard for the truth,[16] which is usually specifically referred to as "actual malice"

Defamation law in the US heavily favors the defendant. Proving that thread/account caused material damage to JP would be nearly impossible in court, especially since any reasonable person would know it's not actually JP from his comments.

If the admins don't intend to enforce 1A as it is enforced in the US they should clarify the rules like they did for calls to violence. This could easily fall under satire (albeit a shitty one) and it seems to be completely at the discretion of the admins and their understanding of 1A at the moment.
body_html:
Defamation =/= Impersonation and it's very clear it's not actually JP from the comments. This is a wrongful ban in my opinion. Libel (written defamation) is only illegal when false statements are made and it can be proven that those statements caused harm to the defamed. I highly doubt that would be the case here.

In the United States, a person must prove that the statement was false, caused harm, and was made without adequate research into the truthfulness of the statement. These steps are for an ordinary citizen. For a celebrity or public official, a person must prove the first three steps, and that the statement was made with the intent to do harm or with reckless disregard for the truth,[16] which is usually specifically referred to as "actual malice"

Defamation law in the US heavily favors the defendant. Proving that thread/account caused material damage to JP would be nearly impossible in court, especially since any reasonable person would know it's not actually JP from his comments.

If the admins don't intend to enforce 1A as it is enforced in the US they should clarify the rules like they did for calls to violence. This could easily fall under satire (albeit a shitty one) and it seems to be completely at the discretion of the admins and their understanding of 1A at the moment.
